intro: Racosperma galioides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub with slender, wiry stems and small, bipinnate leaves. Its yellow flowers are clustered in spikes and bloom during the autumn season. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid and semi-arid regions.
